meaningMnemonic: You know that the alternative kanji meaning for 合 is <kanji>join</kanji>, which is what we're using here. The verb form of join is <vocabulary>to join together</vocabulary>, and it can also mean <vocabulary>to unify</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to match</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 合う, so if you know that reading you'll know this reading as well.
